page.title: 12HOUSES IN EAGLE VILLAGE
page.content: There are very few old houses in Eagle.Almost all the present village is brick built.The class counted 419 dwellings.There were 230 detached bungalows,21 semi-detached bungalows, 98 detached houses,52 semi-detached houses,and 18 terraced houses. At one time the bricks were made loaclly. Traces of the site can be seen behind the 'eight-row'on the north boundary of the parish.In later times the bricks came from Lincoln and almost all of them are now obtained from Peterborough. Eagle is served by five local businesses, a garage , an electrical shop, a butcher'shop and a post office. There are also six mobile shops.From them it is possible to buy ice cream, eggs,fruit and vegetables,fish and chips, wet fish and bread.
